prep_statements

Class CLParser

  • java.lang.Object
    • prep_statements.CLParser

  • public class CLParser
extends java.lang.Object
    Parses command line options using Apache Commons CLI 1.31 or uses the specified property file.
    Version:
    20160225.1
    Author:
    Daniel May, Martin Weber

      • CLParser

        public CLParser(java.lang.String[] args)
        Constructor
        Parameters:
        args - arguments passed by the command line

    • Method Detail

      • setUpOptions

        private void setUpOptions()
        setting up the command line options

      • loadProperties

        private void loadProperties()
        Loads the properties from a file. If the File is not found or a IOException occurs, an error message will be printed out.

      • parseOptions

        private void parseOptions(java.lang.String[] args)
        Parse command line arguments. If a ParseException occurs, the error message and the usage will be printed. The application will be terminated in that case.
        Parameters:
        args - command line arguments

      • printUsage

        private void printUsage()
        Simple wrapper method in order to print the help message including the usage.

      • passwordPrompt

        private void passwordPrompt()
        Detects if a password prompt is forced and executes the prompt.

      • getDatabase

        public java.lang.String getDatabase()
        Gets the database specified by the command line or the property file. If nothing is specified, an error message will be printed out.
        Returns:
        the specified database

      • getHost

        public java.lang.String getHost()
        Gets the hostname specified by the command line or the property file. If nothing is specified, an error message will be printed out.
        Returns:
        the specified hostname

      • getUser

        public java.lang.String getUser()
        Gets the username specified by the command line or the property file. If nothing is specified, an error message will be printed out.
        Returns:
        the specified username

      • getPassword

        public java.lang.String getPassword()
        Detects if the password was specified as argument or entered via password prompt and returns it. If no password is provided, an error message will be printed out.
        Returns:
        the specified password

      • getPort

        public int getPort()
        Gets the port if specified by the command line or the property file, otherwise the standard port for PSQL 5432 will be used. If the specified port number is not an integer the usage will be printed and the application will be terminated.
        Returns:
        the specified port

      • showData

        public boolean showData()
        Gets the command line switch if the data from the select query should be displayed or not. If the value in the property file is not true or True this method will return false. If nothing is specified the result won't be printed out.
        Returns:
        if the data should be displayed

      • getAmount

        public int getAmount()
        Get the amount of specified data rows. If the amount is below 10.000 or not specified, it will be set to 10.000. If the argument is specified, but it is not an integer, the application will be terminated.
        Returns:
        the amount of data rows

      • help

        private void help()
        Checks if the application help is called. If this is the case, the application will terminate after displaying the message.

      • clearPassword

        public void clearPassword()
        Sets the password field to null.
